subject: RE: RE: [junit] [TEST] JTest v4.5 and what is says about JUnit
msgSnippet: ... Yes! Always a good thing. I try to encourage team members to follow this advice whenever possible. I was taught this by a very wise programmer
messageBody:
<snip>

Thus spake J.B.:

>An IAE puts the focus on the calling code; a generic RE puts the focus
>on an external resource this class uses, like a database or a network.
>You may wish, for whatever reason, to make that clear in your code,
>possibly by extending IllegalArgumentException to a class that provides
>better information about what was illegal, when and from whom.

Yes! Always a good thing. I try to encourage team members to follow this advice whenever possible. I was taught this by a very wise programmer (thanks Geoff) and have tried to follow this path myself. The value that it adds to a system is much greater than the effort required to create the exception extra classes.

Simon
